meanings.definition: Having an uneven or jagged edge or surface.
meanings.sent1: The rock with the raggedest edges was the hardest to climb.
meanings.sent2: The old map had the raggedest edges from being folded so many times.
meanings.sent3: The raggedest piece of paper in the class won the award for most unique shape.
meanings.sent4: Her voice sounded like the raggedest edge of a torn piece of fabric.
meanings.sent5: The raggedest edge of the cliff looked dangerous to step on.

meanings.sent1: The scarecrow had the raggedest clothes in the whole field.
meanings.sent2: After playing in the mud, his clothes were the raggedest at the party.
meanings.sent3: The raggedest outfit at the fashion show surprisingly won first place.
meanings.sent4: Her dress looked like the raggedest flag waving in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The raggedest shirt he owned was his favorite for working in the garden.

meanings.definition: In the poorest or most dilapidated condition.
meanings.sent1: The raggedest house on the street was in need of serious repairs.
meanings.sent2: The beggar wore the raggedest clothes, but he always had a smile on his face.
meanings.sent3: The raggedest car in the parking lot surprisingly had the loudest stereo.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like the raggedest building in the abandoned town.
meanings.sent5: The raggedest part of the park was still a favorite spot for picnics.
